attributes.action: Reduce the six week school holidays.
attributes.background: We are now in 2016 which is a different era from times gone by.  Parents work not every parent can rely on free childcare or assistance from grandparents.  When a child is away from school for such a long time it is a detriment to any educational development.
attributes.additional_details: Children go back to school forgetting what they have learned in the previous term.  Many children are not physically active and spend the six week holidays inactive.  Childcare is very expensive children expect to do activities which unfortunately very rarely are free.  Family life is stressful due to the time scale and general cost.  Holidays abroad double.  Time with family is important but we need to look at an agenda which helps parents rather than hinders.  If the holidays are going to continue there needs to be a scheme to aid parents.

attributes.action: To Criminalize Ticket buying bots from buying up tickets for events
attributes.background: Ticket Buying bots should be criminalized and the practice made illegal. botnets are programmes which are used to target ticketing agents. They buy tickets at high speed and stop fans from being able to buy tickets at face value the tickets are then resold on other sites at greater value
attributes.additional_details:
For Example Harry potter tickets £15 pounds per part on the official website 
Stubhub ticket web site anything from £150 - £1750

attributes.action: Make fast food, take aways & restaurants clearly lable items containing alcohol
attributes.background:
All take away, Fast food and restaurants in the UK should have clear labels warning consumers about hidden alcohol in food.
People who don't consume alcohol for religious reasons and parents are unaware alcohol is being consumed when they eat certain products from food outlets.
attributes.additional_details: When I ate in wasabi today I asked if the sushi contained alcohol, I was told the sushi and curries contain alcohol and it's up to the consumer to ask the ingredients they shouldn't have to make people aware of the alcohol in the food. Mortified my child had just eaten the food, I was told it was my fault for not checking before hand. It's time to label food containing alcohol clearly.

attributes.action: Stop Housing Associations charging more than social rent on their properties.
attributes.background: My 20 years old has a 1 bedroom Circle 33 Housing Association property and her rent in £189.00 per week.  Another Circle property 2 minutes away is £129.00 p/w. She is under so much stress and anxiety worrying about getting work and paying her rent and not ending up homeless.
attributes.additional_details: She will have to claim a portion of Housing Benefit as she will not be in a position to pay it all herself.  Surely if the rent was lowered there would be smaller claims for Housing Benefit, possibly no claims at all in some circumstances being made. Surely it is common sense to reduce the rent to reduce the amount of Housing Benefit claims being made.  There is nothing included the £189.00 rent, e.g. water rates or care taking facilities.

attributes.action: Debate changes in child welfare law and update the guidelines
attributes.background: Legislation regarding child welfare and guidelines social work departments work under are outdated. And leaving children vulnerable and at risk.. The law needs updating and quickly, specifically sections related to child abuse verbally abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
I am calling for the law on child neglect, written in 1933, to be overhauled to protect children from being badly fed, left alone at home, not educated or belittled and bullied by their parents.

The 1933 law requires that a child is physically harmed or injured before charges can be brought, yet child neglect is the most common form of maltreatment. It is suggested that around 1.5 million children are affected.

attributes.action: Allow all alternative milks on the school milk scheme for allergy sufferers
attributes.background: Currently the milk scheme in schools allows cows milk, lactose free milk, goats milk and sheep milk which are not suitable for children who have a dairy allergy. I feel that a child shouldn't be excluded from having milk, this is preventing them from much needed nutrients and are being singled out
attributes.additional_details: I would like to see the scheme offer alternative milks which are suitable for children with allergies such as almond, oat or coconut. Another alternative would be soya, however, this isn't suitable for all children with a dairy allergy.  This would then allow all children to have the milk they should be entitled to. Milk is very important for any child and they shouldn't have the opportunity taken away from them just because they have a dairy allergy.

attributes.action: Free school transport for primary schools and high schools
attributes.background: Costs of travelling to school everyday add ups and parents struggle to pay for it. Also, the safety of the children is at risk of getting kidnapped or killed due to having to walk miles to school alone and/or on busy roads.

attributes.action: Make bonfires a criminal offence except on 5 November and the nearest weekend
attributes.background: Bonfires are environmentally unfriendly and pollute the houses, gardens and washing of the people nearest to it. This can be a considerable radius depending on the atmospheric conditions. It is unacceptable for people to have to close their windows - whatever the weather - to keep smoke out.

attributes.action: If UK weather reaches 30degrees people should get sent home from work on pay.
attributes.background:
Comfortable working environment.
To hot to work indoors. I.e factory's etc or any buildingwith broken aircon or without any Aircon.
attributes.additional_details:
UK workers.
Factory's,call centers etc or any other place with no aircon facilities.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to use national flags for party political purposes.
attributes.background: National symbols, e.g. the Union Jack and St George's Cross, are often used by political parties wishing to add legitimacy to their views. This means that symbols that should represent everyone, regardless of politics, ethnicity or religion, have become linked to particular political agendas.

attributes.action: I want the government to recognise  severe neuropathy as a disability
attributes.background: Neuropathy is a extremely painful progressive disease. Nothing can cure it,there is only treatment for the pain.It usually starts in the feet,then hands but eventually affects the whole body

attributes.action: To scrap Grades 1 - 9 and go back to A - U grading/marking.
attributes.background: There is no standardised system or coherent system that any one school can take and use. The system is failing children as schools are unsure how to use the new marking system so the children suffer. This petition is highlighting the need to revert back to simple but effective A - U marking.
attributes.additional_details: As teachers we have a duty of care towards our children and if we are unable to mark correctly, the Department for Education is setting schools and children up to fail. We have not seen any good positive need for this marking system and we are now angry at having to use it over and above a perfectly good marking system used for many years prior. Children’s minds should not be bogged down with a complicated marking system. Go back to A - U, keep it simple and teaching improves.

attributes.action: Allow Spouses of Work Permit Holders to apply for ILR based on Domestic Violence
attributes.background: In June 2016,I finally sought help about the Domestic Violence against me. It was just 1 month before my husband would have obtained his Indefinite Leave to Remain(ILR). He now has a criminal record and may not get ILR. I am not eligible to apply for DV ILR because he is neither British nor Settled
attributes.additional_details: Under UK Immigration Law, only partners of British nationals/settled persons facing domestic violence (DV) can apply for settlement.This law forces people with abusive immigrant partners to stay on in the marriage.I have worked in the UK as a legal adviser for 5+ years but endured intense DV.I spoke out a month before my immigrant spouse would have acquired settlement.Now, I cannot apply for settlement for myself/2 kids born in the UK, just because I did not endure violence for yet another month

attributes.action: Get NHS backing for MAP vaccine for Crohn's disease and colitis cure
attributes.background: I am a Crohn's disease and colitis sufferer. Life is very difficult because there is no cure. There is a possible cure at the Kings college hospital. The trials cannot go ahead because there is not enough funding. Meanwhile IBD sufferers have to struggle with life. This vaccine could help cure IBD
attributes.additional_details: There are 250,000 people in the UK that suffer from IBD, over 80% need to have surgery to correct or remove the colon. It is a chronic disease which is debilitating. Prof. John. Hermon - Taylor has worked out that a bacteria found in cattle is transferred to humans with a weak immune system. I have to have lots of medication to get through each day and have been hospitalised because I cannot get a remission. Crohn's and colitis sufferers are desperate for a cure. The vaccine is ready to test

attributes.action: No fees for parents who wish to know info about their kids from social services
attributes.background: When couples separate, it's very difficult to iron out the terms when it comes to children and many end up in court. For a non residential parent, they must apply for information from social services and then pay a fee to get written information. None can be given by phone
attributes.additional_details: Bromley Council was contacted by a father to ask what is happening with he's daughter, as court cafcass reports stated problems with the health and education of he's child.  Social services said he must apply for freedom of information by form on their website. The letter he recieved back stated he needs to pay £10 fee plus obtain documents such as birth certificate for he's child. The mother has this so he also has to buy he's own at a cost. This info should be free once ID or rights proven

attributes.action: Pass a law to allow left turns on a red light.
attributes.background: Will reduce traffic congestion and pollution from stationary traffic waiting to turn left at a red light... This road traffic law is legal in many other countries, lets introduce here in the UK...

attributes.action: Abolish Sunday trading laws.
attributes.background: Scotland has abolished them, so why can't we!

attributes.action: Instigate a root & branch review of The FA
attributes.background: Following the dismal performances of the senior England football team in the European Championships it is time for an effective review of The FA and in particular the senior England set up.
attributes.additional_details: Having failed to qualify for the European championships in 2008 a root and branch review was allegedly carried out. This has clearly had no long lasting effect on the organisation and this  petition is to request that Tracey Crouch MP, Minister for Sport brings pressure upon the FA to carry out a full review of the circumstances surrounding the failings during this championship. This should include selection of inappropriate squad players.

attributes.action: To review spent criminal convictions on a dbs after 10 years have elapsed.
attributes.background:
I was convicted 15 years ago of possession with intent to supply cannabis. 
I served my community service order and have never or will never re-offend.
The problem I have know is this will always show on a dbs disclosure and has stopped me, in some cases having a good career.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst I understand certain convictions should remain on a dbs disclosure permanently, my view is that a lot of people deserve a bona fide second chance. 
A wiping of the slate clean so to speak. I don't want myself and probably many others to keep on getting refused the chance to do better for themselves and their families because of a mistake they've made many years ago and have properly rehabilitated from. 
I urge the government to seriously consider this and let genuinely remorseful people move on.

attributes.action: Allow Tunbridge Wells a referendum to separate from the UK alongside Scotland.
attributes.background:
Tunbridge Wells voted in favour of remaining as part of the EU against the trend of the rest of the country.

Please allow Tunbridge Wells an independence referendum (along the lines of the inevitable Scottish Referendum for independence) so that it can renegotiate itself back into the EU.

attributes.action: Poll Leave the EU Voters their reasons and present this to the EU before Brexit.
attributes.background: Anti-EU sentiment is not exclusive to the UK. With a Brexit, it is clear the EU will need to implement reforms to prevent other Nations from following suit. Why wait for the UK to leave the EU before reforming? Poll those who voted Leave for their reasons (it is currently not clear). Present these.
attributes.additional_details:
The EU should use this poll result of Leave voters to present reforms. The UK can then vote again that with these reforms, do we still want to leave the EU? 

Some may argue that David Cameron already asked for reforms. However, it is clear few really actually believed the UK would vote to leave. Now that it is clear, ask why the people voted this way and the EU should present new reforms. 

EU reforms will need to come. The EU has the chance now to do so before a Brexit actually happens.

attributes.action: Referendum on making London a principality with right to remain in the EU
attributes.background: Following the overwhelming support from London voters for the UK to remain in the EU, we request that HM Government consider the option to allow London (as a principality of the U.K.) to remain in the EU - if necessary, following a second referendum/London-only vote.

attributes.action: Make London, Northern Ireland and Scotland an independent EU state.
attributes.background: The Majority of Scotland, Northern Ireland and London have voted to remain in the UK. So I ask Parliament to hold a referendum to make London Northern Ireland and Scotland a separate state of the European Union.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence as per EU Referendum results in press.

attributes.action: Bristol to receive a referendum to leave the UK and form an independent Nation
attributes.background: After vote leave won we believe that the United Kingdom does not speak or represent Bristol anymore and believe it better to move in a different direction from the UK

attributes.action: Make it the law for defibrillators to be at sports centres, schools, businesses
attributes.background: Earlier this year I went to a netball tournament as usual and during the match a friends mum dropped down in front of us and died, if there was a defibrillator at the sports centre she could've lived. This isn't good enough, we should go out of our way to keep lives safe. Make defibrillators the law
attributes.additional_details: Cardiac arrests and Sudden Adult Death affects everyone, no one is safe from this dreadful thing. Therefore I want to encourage all adults and young people to sign and give support to make a change!

attributes.action: An electronic voting system needs bringing in.
attributes.background: By moving forward from the outdated paper-based voting system you will squash a lot of the rumours of a rigged election as many people do not trust the governing body. I know many people who do not vote because they believe that their votes are essentially changed due to having to use a pencil.
attributes.additional_details: Not only would an updated voting system be a step in the right direction but also it wood make our country look better and more fair. People may also be able to trust an electronic voting system more than the current paper-based one.

attributes.action: Regulate mobile phone bundled contracts to stop hidden charges & data misselling
attributes.background: Consumer request to regulate over-charging in 24 month bundled contracts, ensuring clearer, transparent pricing for both the phone and the tariff in the contract, ensuring customers can get access to their data consumption and aren’t overcharged for data they don’t need, or overpay for the phone.
attributes.additional_details:
consumers know they aren't getting the best deal http://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/bills/article-3517540/The-mobile-phone-rip-Confusing-tariffs-unclear-pricing-shoddy-sales-staff-mean-overpaying-130-phone-contracts.html 
over £5bn per year being wasted by being on the wrong contracts https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2011/apr/11/mobile-phone-users-wasting-5bn customers need have greater access and more control over their service contracts with the networks http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3973532/Millions-mobile-phone-users-able-ditch-supplier-mid-contract-t-signal-plan-MPs-beat-coverage-blackspots.html

attributes.action: Somaliland Recognition
attributes.background:
There is very few and far countries left in the world without full international recognition. Seat with united Nations and all that goes with been a recognise state.
Yet right in the middle of most strategic countries on this planet sets this forgotten  country of Somaliland.
attributes.additional_details:
for the last 25 years its people are calling for the international  community to give them basic freedom to self determine their own affairs and become state. Yet, the Republic of Somaliland has survived to become a relatively stable and democratic state.
Somaliland and UK always had strong ties, working on development, security and regional stability. This can be build Somaliland standing it’s own foot and recognised by statehood

attributes.action: Stop phone  calling. Make it illegal to withhold a company phone number.
attributes.background: Anonymous phone calls, often 10 a day are causing great distress to many people especially the elderly. The telephone preference service does not work; companies either ignore it or say that we contacted them or showed interest when we did not. They are an unacceptable nuisance.

attributes.action: Scrap the Severn bridge tolls!
attributes.background:
Their is no need for the Severn bridge to have tolls! It is proven that they don't need it anymore. It makes 90 million and the mantence costs are 15 million...so where's the rest of the money going?! 

You don't pay to go to Scotland....so why do we have to pay to go to Wales.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2015 overall revenue from the tolls was over £90m, while it had been suggested that maintenance costs amounted to between £13m and £15m.

It would be a major boost for the Welsh ecomony, but it is getting held back from getting that vital boost.

attributes.action: A 2nd EU Referendum to be held with Compulsory Voting for the Eligible.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to Conduct a 2nd Referendum with Compulsory voting  for all who are eligible, with an abstention option on the ballot paper. This will give a true majority of the UK voters wishes regarding the EU and a true mandate to Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: The British Election Study asked a question on whether people regretted how they voted or not. Only 1% of people who voted Remain said they regretted their vote, but 6% of people who voted Leave said they regretted their vote.

attributes.action: Start making Gazumping Illegal.
attributes.background: We put in an offer for a House about 3 weeks ago it got accepted. Mortgage approved everything. Then Tuesday 1st November 2016 got told that someone put in a Higher  offer and that got accepted. So now left High and Dry.
attributes.additional_details: We don't want this happening to other people

attributes.action: Make it law that qualified electricians are allowed to break seals on cutouts
attributes.background: It is time that us electricians of which are highly trained and aware of electricity at work act do our jobs.
attributes.additional_details: Jobs can become more expensive and time consuming relying on an already over stretched national grid.  Just as BT had to open openreach allow electricians the right for basic electrical connections and force national grid to sell new seals.

attributes.action: Reduce the amount of tax charged on fuel
attributes.background: Far too much excise duty is placed on fuel leading in increased costs to the consumer

attributes.action: Find accommodation for all unaccompanied children stranded in  Calais Jungle
attributes.background:
1500 children stranded in containers and tents around the area known as the Jungle in Calais urgently need appropriate housing 
& support,
 To leave unaccompanied minors who have been left to fend for themselves  is immoral, unsafe and reckless.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/the-calais-jungle-has-become-like-lord-of-the-flies-with-1500-children-left-behind-in-containers-and-a7388021.html

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/calais-jungle-latest-refugee-children-unaccompanied-minors-camp-migrants-destroyed-relocated-moved-a7386551.html

attributes.action: Let the victims decide who should next head the Westminster abuse.inquiry.
attributes.background: Someone who is trusted or members of the public should put forward respectable candidates from which the victims should choose the head of the inquiry. The main qualification required by potential candidates is integrity.
attributes.additional_details: WE MUST HAVE ANSWERS

attributes.action: No confidence vote in Amber Rudd for denying visa to bone marrow donor.
attributes.background: May Brown, 23, from Dorset, who has leukaemia, has been told that her Nigerian sister Martha is a "10 out of 10" tissue match.  However, the Home Office denied a visa because "all visa applications must be assessed against the immigration rules".
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-dorset-37656377

attributes.action: The Royal Marines Calendar should be allowed
attributes.background: Allow the Royal Marines to release thier annual calendar to raise money for essential charities. If the government cannot fund the charities the Royal Marines want to support, then allow them to raise the money by making a calendar!

attributes.action: Scrap the BBC Television Licence.
attributes.background: The BBC licence fee is a unlawful tax against watching television. The BBC should not dictate our ability to watch television such as ITV and Channel 4.

attributes.action: Ban the use of button batteries in children's toys
attributes.background:
The UK is seeing a large increase in serious injuries, and in some cases death, from children swallowing button batteries. 
At the same time, we are seeing an large increase in the use of button batteries in children's toys. 
Surely this cannot be coincidence?
attributes.additional_details:
Why are we using several button batteries when a single AA or AAA battery would do the same job with a minimal increase in size? 
AA type batteries are much less appetising to toddlers and babies who have managed to open their toys to reveal a potentially fatal prize, as well as being much harder to swallow.
My toddler hasn't been injured, thankfully, but when I started to think about how many of his toys contain 3 or 4 of these batteries each, I became quite concerned.

attributes.action: A law that Family Courts factor evidence of Alienation Inducement in its ruling
attributes.background: Children being alienated from one parent by another is common in Family Court contact requests or custody cases. This is psychologically harmful to the child and prolongs the court process unnecessarily. There are many papers about Alienation Inducement and the consequent Parent Alienation Syndrome

attributes.action: Nationalise Utility companies and regenerate UK infrastructure with the profits.
attributes.background: The privatised utility companies run a virtual monopoly with an arcane pricing structure designed to confuse. There was no evidence of significantly more inefficiency when they were previously in public ownership and unlike transport we all rely absolutely on utility companies for our wellbeing.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that given the option the majority of people in the UK would support a return to public ownership,  regardless of political persuasion. If necessary this might be an option for the larger metropolitan areas to run as pilot schemes initially , with a local poll conducted independently of any political party.

attributes.action: Facilitate access and use of Automatic External Defibrillators (AED's)
attributes.background:
"In emergency medicine, the golden hour is the period following traumatic injury being sustained by a casualty, during this hour there is the highest likelihood that prompt medical treatment will prevent death."

For heart related emergency's the early use of an AED can be key for preserving life.
attributes.additional_details:
It is frustrating to know that AED technology is out there and publicly available and that many first aiders are trained in AED use.

I acknowledge and welcome this progress but it's difficult to get these two components together at the right place at the right time to make full use of the Golden Hour of patient care.

I ask parliament to vigorously consider the following:

1. Funding/grants so trained first aiders have their own AED.

2. A database of public AED's that can be added to mobile phone maps.

attributes.action: Seek a UN treaty on mutual recognition and enforcement of telephone privacy laws
attributes.background: Despite using the TPS, I have been bombarded with spam telephone calls from India and some other foreign countries. Many of these calls are barely disguised scams. Within the EU there is mutual recognition of such schemes and it works well. This should be extended by treaty to all nations in the ITU
attributes.additional_details:
TPS = Telephone Preference Service
ITU = International Telecommunications Union, a UN agency

To understand what gave me this idea, see: https://www.quora.com/What-is-the-creepiest-phone-call-or-voice-message-youve-ever-received/answer/Peter-Charlot and my (Charles Stuart) comment.

Ofcom recognizes that people outside the EU are beyond their control. I would like a treaty to address this and set up mandatory reciprocal recognition of cold calling laws among ITU member states.

attributes.action: Free prescriptions for stroke survivors
attributes.background: Make prescriptions free of charge on any medication for stroke survivors

attributes.action: Start a public consultation and debate about the future funding of the NHS
attributes.background: The NHS is in financial crisis. I believe it is now time for the electorate to be consulted for their views on how this might be resolved for the future, as successive governments appear to be struggling to find a solution.

attributes.action: Make premium rate text services need physical signature on terms and charges.
attributes.background: Premium rate text services send you a text message on your mobile and when you reply/text stop, you get charged without knowing charges or terms and conditions of service. Mobile operators charge on their behalf and you can't contact these premium rate text providers.
attributes.additional_details: It's happening all too often and to vulnerable people. Make it must for premium rate text services providers to get physical signature of billpayers on charges , terms and conditions for these services.

attributes.action: Reduce the Foreign Aid budget and use the monies to fund Social Housing
attributes.background: Reduce the Foreign Aid Budget and use the monies to fund a Social Housing scheme to ensure all UK Veterans and homeless families have somewhere safe to live.  Any monies left can also fund Social Housing for the rest of the Country and then use the rents raised towards upkeep.

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory driving licence re-testing for old age pensioners
attributes.background:
It has been shown numerous times that old age causes lowered reflexes and reaction times. This has been reflected in the high level of accidents and poor driving from pensioners.

To maintain the standards of driving on UK roads, I propose mandatory re-testing above a certain age (perhaps ~70).
attributes.additional_details:
Here's is the most recent example of many: 

"Eight car pile-up after elderly driver goes wrong way down motorway"

http://metro.co.uk/2016/08/31/eight-car-pile-up-after-elderly-driver-goes-wrong-way-down-motorway-6101485/#ixzz4IzPn56B6

Studies suggest that older drivers are no more dangerous than young drivers, but it is scientifically certain that old age results in degradation of the senses. As such, it stands to reason that there is a point when driving is no longer a safe endeavour.

attributes.action: Repeal the Psychoactive Substances Act 2016.
attributes.background:
Repeal the Psychoactive Substances Act 2016. Legal highs have been around for 20 years until the unsubstantiated hype of dangers.

We are in an era where countries are criminalising drugs and with this act the UK has gone backwards because of unsubstantiated hype.
attributes.additional_details:
We now know that former legal highs are available illegally and have become more dangerous. The industry still exists. It is wasting police time and resources when we should be focusing on terror and more important matters. Even the UN says drugs should be decriminalised.

UK Parliament has made more people into criminals when it is supposed to be criminal justice reform. The Equalities Commission & the PM said coloured people are more likely to go to jail this is racist legislation.
